descendants.content:
@canleaf @renewable_energy I think this invention deserves #solarpunk hashtag :-)

Of course I am from generation, which experienced this natural way of drying laundry as a child. It even works without sun, because in the winter, the ice sublimates directly into dry air. It only has issues in wet, rainy days 😉

I think part of the problem is that solutions, which were originally invented as marginal (like laundry drying) quickly became overused in conditions, under which they are not necessary.... and there is maybe feeling, that they disclose low social status and therefore are banned by communities which strive for higher social status (but do it wrong, of course)

If you are establishing social movement for traditional open air laundry drying, just count me in :-) I am quite conservative :-))

account.note:
Nedokončil studia na vysoké škole života. Mužský rod neživotný, tykej mi. Patřím do téhle části světa: 🇨🇿 🇪🇺 🇺🇦

ADHD. ⁂ Moderator of f.cz. We recycle waste heat of our datacenter to heat water for 15 apartments.

SpráFce obsahu instance f.cz. Odpadní teplo datacentra ISP SPOJE.NET, kde tohle běží, ohřívá vodu 15 bytům. Solární cyklista, cestovatel. Linuxák, ex-programátor (Arachne), ex-muzikant. Fanoušek kosmického výzkumu, vědy a techniky. Zakládající člen Pirátů.

🐧 🚀 🐘 🚲

descendants.content: @xChaos @canleaf @renewable_energy I have three ways to line dry clothes. One in the outside in the sun. One in the outside under the eaves. One inside, in the laundry room on rails near the ceiling. Covers most conditions with an occasional 20 minutes in the tumble dryer to finish off where necessary

account.note:
I live on Wadjuk Noongar Boodja. Unrepentant quilter. Gardener. Keen on permaculture. Social justice advocate. Low Fodmap. Choirs are the best. Pronouns she/ her. Married to my DH. I am the Mother of the house.

I read books, know things, and avoid people.

The profile picture is my black and white fluffy cat. I, however, am a fairly short, fairly senior lady with a fabulous white haircut.

#nobridge

descendants.content: @earthmothering9 @canleaf @renewable_energy I also dry laundry on line, either home or outdoor in the summer. I only use dryers if I need to use public laundromats when I am on the road.

descendants.content:
@xChaos We have a foldable camping rotary clothesline, which is mostly put out in the sun, but can be put under a gazebo, so sudden rain showers won't re-wet nearly dry clothes. Sheets go on the big long line, on sunny, blowy days...and are usually dry in an hour or two. Clotheslines need not take up a heap of space, and fresh, clean air is good, healthwise.
Dryers are excellent for wet days, and low spoon days. @canleaf @renewable_energy
